website_summaries.verdict: The Pokemon Go Plus might seem like an expensive accessory for a free app, but it can make Pokemon Go addiction symptoms more bearable.
pros: The Pokemon Go Plus turns some of the most monotonous parts of Pokemon Go into simple button presses
Discreet, easy-to-identify vibration patterns let you play without others noticing
cons: Loses connection often, and has to be manually reconnected
Doesn't make Pokemon Go a better game
Chunky plastic design leaves something to be desired

customer_reviews.title: Gotta Catch Em All!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great companion if you like Pokemon Go! You don't have to use it as a bracelet, you can just clip it anywhere. This is very helpful when you are not able to take your phone out. So far no glitches, no problems, and easy set-up!!
customer_reviews.author: Casey JonesTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Seriously, don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: despite the negative reviews I bought it. Liked it the first day despite the many disconnects. I'm assuming (still do) that it's a battery saving feature, though it doesn't warn you. I replaced the battery in case that was the issue, but it's still a real bear to get reconnected most of the time. I thought, "hey, it's been out a year...I'm sure it works better than the reviewers say, right?!" No. Don't buy it. If you do, do it soon, so when you're ready to toss it out the window you can re-gift it to someone else who's been wanting one. Share the...love. :p
customer_reviews.author: Dan Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit Item from seller holyfly
customer_reviews.text: Arrived from overseas. It doesn't come in Pokemon go plus packaging but generic packaging. The item needs a 100% fresh battery for it to work. If you use the item 2 or more sessions, the go plus will keep on disconnecting from the game. I thought it was a cheap battery at first, but I used a new one that I purchased from Amazon. I wouldn't recommend buying from this buyer at all. The item also has a team logo printed on the front of the go plus. This is different from the official go plus I bought when this device first came out.
customer_reviews.author: Sofa King

customer_reviews.title: No longer concerned about version
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous about this when I discovered it was shipped from Japan. When it arrived I found it was in fact the Japanese version, complete with instructions I can not read. I tried to connect it anyway, using the English instructions from a friend, and it works just fine! As far as I can tell there is no regional restrictions on the device, but the "version" defines the packaging and instruction language. As far as use goes, I am enjoying it. It does disconnect after maybe 20 minutes, but it is only mildly irritating.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Chinese, not original version from Nintendo
customer_reviews.text: It's not the Nintendo Pokemon Go Plus version, this is a chinese compatible device. I was expecting an original version due to the price compared to others sellers, but it definitely wasn't the Nintendo version and is way more expensive than those others chinese. The description should be changed to compatible chinese Pokemon Go Plus, so it does'nt trick the sellers thinking it's original due to the price. Anyway it worked well and has all the characteristics described, it came with the accesories listed in the picture in a normal box.
customer_reviews.author: Heber Medina

customer_reviews.title: Batteries Ran Out Fast/Had Connection Issues
customer_reviews.text: This item was disappointing because the batteries ran out within a few hours and always had connection issues. I didn't have an easy time figuring out it's features or how it worked. On top of that, I bought this to wear on my wrist but couldn't because nothing secures the toy to it's band other than some flimsy connection, I can't even tell what. It kinda sits there and falls out too easily to be used. I really wanted to use it because I needed it but I guess making a product work properly was too much to ask.
customer_reviews.author: EliteReviewsUSA

customer_reviews.title: No longer works with iOS
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this no longer works the way it's supposed to with the newest iOS update. We usually use our watches in the car so we can hit pokestops or catch Pokemon at red lights or if we're driving slowly, but now instead of being able to hit the button as soon as it buzzes you have to let it go through like 6 buzzes in order for the click to register. Totally defeats the purpose and makes the three we bought essentially useless. We've been waiting for a fix for weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: Pokémon Go - (- for your catch rate)
customer_reviews.text: I am very upset that I spent my money on such a bad device. It is only good for spinning money stops but even then you need to push a button on the device to get your stuff. It would be so much better to be automated. Most of all my catch rate is going down by using this device. I am almost to level 39 in PG so I know it is not working as well to catering Pokémon as it does when I use my mobile device. If there where more options in the PG+ settings or on the device it would be a better device to use.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio M

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: Do not believe what the description says. This thing will NOT maintain a bluetooth connection. I have spent hours researching this and nothing online that says it will fix the problem actually does. You'll get it connected then 2 or 5 minutes later, the connection is lost. So you spend you time monitoring the connection on your phone instead of playing the game. So why have the plus? Nothing but disappointment and headache. Totally bogus product.
customer_reviews.author: Bezo Gillthorpe

customer_reviews.title: fix bluetooth and it's perfect
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful, transforms the PokemonGO experience into something I can do casually throughout the day. I catch all kinds of pokemon that I would've passed by, spin pokestops that I would've just ignored. Not having to keep the app in the foreground, or even have your phone awake, is really liberating. My only gripe - it does lose the Bluetooth connection every hour or so. Sometimes it will vibrate to notify you of this which is nice but easy to miss (I would like it to keep vibrating/red until reconnected, or attempt to reconnect on its own). There doesn't seem to be any one reason for this but hopefully it gets patched.
customer_reviews.author: mshock

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: The one I recieved works great. I've had it since around Feb 2017 and haven't had to change the battery yet (although I have it set to only spin pokestops). I don't have connection issues at all other than the occasional disconnect once it's been on for around 30-45 mins (from what I've heard this happens with all of them). No complaints here. I like that it allows me to gain distance on my eggs without draining the battery on my phone because I don't have to walk around with the screen unlocked all the time anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not with IOS 11
customer_reviews.text: A real carpal tunnel saver. Started using this device at level 37. Works well, but prioritizes critter catches over pokestop spins, which occasionally means you run out of red balls. Not a big deal. Either buy more (expensive) or turn off the Pokemon catch option and catch manually (preferred). The device will extend the range of pokemon catches and gyms that can be spun when traveling by automobile...as long as you keep the speed down around "school zone" level. Note that IOS 11.03 really screws up this device. If you wish to use the Plus, do not install IOS 11 or downgrade to IOS 10 until Nintendo/Apple get their act together.
customer_reviews.author: Greg T

customer_reviews.title: This is so great to use to play Pokemon Go
customer_reviews.text: This is so great to use to play Pokemon Go! I can just turn on my bluetooth on my phone, and have it running in the background while I listen to music or an audiobook during a walk or jog. I usually just carry mine in my hand and don't bother using it as a watch. It's also safer to play Pokemon Go with so that you're not constantly looking down at your phone. Only downsides are: 1) you won't know when there are raids/gyms to battle, but you will buzz when you're in range of the gym to spin the pokestop. 2) You only use pokeballs to catch pokemon, and won't use great or ultra balls.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget!
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact I got Prime shipping on this, and at a really good price too. The item itself works great with my Android Grand Prime, and there's really no complaints to be had. Setup is super easy, and the real clincher is how much battery life it saves on my phone while outside. I use it at work too, and after turning off the Go+ notifications for pokemon/pokestops, I can still hatch eggs and get candy at my retail job while keeping it in my pant pockets. A+ piece of tech. Wish Niantic/Nintendo would be better at making more of these things.
customer_reviews.author: NIKtendo

customer_reviews.title: Catch more Pokemon than you would normally have.
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have. I've got 2 accounts and a Go Plus for each one. I have caught 140,000 Pokemon on my main account and most of them have come from the Go Plus. I secretly catch them at work with it, because I can't do it from my phone. easily catch it when I'm in my car or out in public when you normally wouldn't be playing on your phone. It only uses your Red Poke' Balls, so throw away the Blue Great Balls to save bag space for more of the Red Poke' Balls.
customer_reviews.author: pattayarick

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: No problems at all out of the box, the original battery lasted a good 6 months before needing replacement. Very glad I can enjoy the game without needing to constantly look at my phone. The connectivity is good even when I'm in areas with subpar service. It also comes in very handy during Community Day and other limited-time events--I can let the Plus try to catch normal Pokémon while I look for shinies to manually catch.
customer_reviews.author: kG

customer_reviews.title: Low quality. Started falling apart after a month of ...
customer_reviews.text: Low quality. Started falling apart after a month of use. First the button became unresponsive and would require 4 or 5 clicks before registering, which usually meant that I’d already traveled too far away from a gym to get anything. Then, the screw holding the front and back together just up and stripped itself out of its hole, so now I’m forced to use it with the battery exposed. I COULD glue it but then once the battery died it’d just be trash. Expected more from Nintendo.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Battery and vibrations are a con
customer_reviews.text: The worst part when I first got it was the insanely loud vibrations it made every time. Like i could not use it in the school library kind of loud. After getting over that, the batteries last for about a week if you use it consistently. Which is very bad for the environment, for starters, and for my wallet. After about half a year, I’m hanging this up for a rechargeable gotcha because of how often this guy goes through batteries. If you’re fine getting batteries for it, it’s a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Snesrud

customer_reviews.title: For the love of dogs, and pokemon
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been playing Pokemon Go from the beginning, we are avid walkers and I grew up playing the games. Walking while catching Pokemon and managing two dogs at once can be a bit much, so being able to press a button when alerted is very helpful. Also very convenient when jogging. A couple of notes, you cannot use berries, nor can you choose what kind of ball to throw. If multiple Pokemon pop up you cannot choose. But you do get the steps without having to look at your phone constantly. Someday Blissey will be ours.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline DeLorie

customer_reviews.title: but 25 mph seems to be the sweet spot. One thing to know that they don't ...
customer_reviews.text: This device was a game changer to me when it came to Pokemon Go. It'll spin stops for you, even when driving, if you simply press the button when you vibrate. I've spun stops at up to 40 mph, but 25 mph seems to be the sweet spot. One thing to know that they don't elaborate on... unpairing this device is a little more complicated than simply 'forgetting' it on your iphone. I have since traded in this Pokemon GO+ for a Go-Tcha; a much more superior alternative to the GO+.
customer_reviews.author: Eric R. Shaver

customer_reviews.title: Overall worth it
customer_reviews.text: Good - Get more distance on your eggs. I can hatch 2k's no problem and even 5k's in a day of normal sedentary activitiy, if I'm vigilant in making sure my plus is connected. Will pick up pokemon that you don't see on your phone, so if you're playing with friends, you'll be catching/losing pokemon that they don't even have a chance catching. Bad - spotty on notifying for pokemon and pokestops. Frustrating at times bc it keeps disconnecting. Have to check phone every 20 minutes or so to make sure it didn't disconnect. Sometimes it notifies you that it did disconnect, sometimes it doesn't. Overall - I paid $35 for this and think it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: PoGo Plus is great
customer_reviews.text: After using this for some time I thought I'd write a review. I enjoy the Plus very much and find it very handy and convenient to just get stops, catch pokemon, and hatching eggs all without having to bring out my phone. However there is still the flaw of the device only throwing on regular pokeball and the downside of it being a catch or it runs away. If it used to just do the basics and not try to do major pokemon hunting then it'll work wonders for you.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ramirez-Sunstrom

customer_reviews.title: Bugs on Pokemon Go
customer_reviews.text: Connectivity issue with Android. Probably Pokemon Go bug. Currently it works only about 10% of time. Other family member use iOS device. It seems working about 50% of case. Pokemon Go app is the worst buggy app I've ever used. It got much better than before, but still far below standard.
customer_reviews.author: CZI

customer_reviews.title: forcing you to purchase from regular balls regardless of how many Great or Ultra balls you have
customer_reviews.text: I wish this product actually worked as advertised. If I don't keep the app open to the front of my phone, it restarts each time you go back to the app. It was my understanding that the whole idea behind the Go Plus was that you didn't need to keep the app open to the front of the phone. Also, when you run out of regular Pokeballs, you can't use it to catch Pokemon anymore, forcing you to purchase from regular balls regardless of how many Great or Ultra balls you have. Overall, a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: David Edmonds

customer_reviews.title: Great for grinding but horrible Android connectivity.
customer_reviews.text: Update: The connectivity problem is just as bad on iOS. Certainly makes game play more efficient especially when you're just grinding on +30 levels.I gave it two stars because despite software updates the Pokemon Go Plus constantly looses it's Bluetooth connection to Android devices. I can't speak for iOS but connectivity to Android is awful. Easily dropping a dozen times a day and about half the time re-pairing or restarting the device. I've tried on three different devices all with the same results. I hate to recommend such a poorly engineered product but the efficiencies gained do outweigh the problems. Just be forewarned.
customer_reviews.author: EnduroDriver

customer_reviews.title: Defective batch?
customer_reviews.text: The current product batch is defective. Within a day or so you get the low battery icon and it starts disconnecting from your phone repeatedly. I contacted the manufacturer. A year or so ago the ones I bought worked perfectly. Recently, I have purchased three and all three were defective. Update - one of the defective ones was from this seller and one was another seller so I’m guessing / hoping it’s a batch problem.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer53662

customer_reviews.title: Do not over pay for this device
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to find one for the original price of $35.00 but when I received it. The Pokemon Go instructions failed to let me know that you needed to go to your settings and pair it that way via the app not your phone settings, while linked up to your phone it has been awesome in terms of getting me a crap ton of items. This device relies on Pokeballs being in your inventory in the game, Great Balls and Ultra Balls should be saved for when you're playing the app on the phone. Its great but don't pay too much for it.
customer_reviews.author: VendusYT

customer_reviews.title: Very Buggy
customer_reviews.text: PROs: 1) great for the lazy player CONs: 1) frequent loss of connection makes you have phone out just as much as you would without the device. 2) doesn’t always pickup nearby Pokémon. Does a good job with poke stops, though 3) software updates have rendered the device useless for weeks at a time, until future software fixes get released. 4) will only use red balls. Once you’re out of red balls it won’t start using great balls. This option seems like such an easy no brained thing to program.
customer_reviews.author: "atilisa"

customer_reviews.title: You gotta get this
customer_reviews.text: Imagine catching two Pokémon at once, or catching one while in a battle or even collecting a stop. How you ask? Use this plus your phone. This will auto detect a Pokémon and catch it for you even if you’re doing something else on your phone including in the app. Catch rate is 8/10 and only issue is it doesn’t collect a pokestop until all nearby Pokémon are gone. Hope you have lots of pokeballs
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: during which I loved it, and now it's an ugly useless bracelet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in June. Sept 5th my phone moto z updated to Android 7.1 and the go plus completely stopped working. And yes I have gone through all the convoluted suggestions to get it working; they do not work. It is a 'known issue' with several brands of phone and Android 7.1 and the pogo plus version of Bluetooth, and the various companies involved (Nintendo, Niantic, Lenovo, etc) show NO interest in fixing it. So I had a couple months of use, during which I loved it, and now it's an ugly useless bracelet.
customer_reviews.author: Lynelle V

customer_reviews.title: Buy from a trusted dealer and you won't have regrets.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, truly amazing. I've hatched what seems like countless eggs with this thing. It does disconnect after a long idle period, but is easy to reconnect (takes like 15 seconds if that). I've grabbed multiple pokestops with it while driving, which I wouldn't have been able to grab with the app launched. Not only does it grab them, you aren't fumbling with your phone while driving (much less safe). Give it a whirl! It's made the game so much more fun for me!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Such a timesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I could kick myself for not getting one sooner! It's awesome that I can scoop up Pokémon and shake down Pokéstops without looking at the screen or even having Pokémon Go active (a necessity when my phone's at 10% power). No more phubbing or waiting for every capture animation sequence! Most excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Erik C.

customer_reviews.title: I love it. If you're a casual or occasional player
customer_reviews.text: I wish Niantic would build more possible functions into this, but even so, I love it. If you're a casual or occasional player, you might not find it worth the money, but if you're a bit more serious and hate missing a pokestop, you'll love it. Not to mention, it helps cut down on the battery drain on your phone as it watches for stops, pokemon, and credits you with walking distance even if your phone screen isn't powered on, as long as the app is running.
customer_reviews.author: Pacific Tyger

customer_reviews.title: Great for Egg Hatching and Pokestops!
customer_reviews.text: So much easier than having to hold your phone the whole time! The range for reaching Pokestops is bigger too and it's great for hatching eggs (even while riding in a car). My only complaint is that I didn't care for the actual wrist strap part, but there are plenty of good, comfy replacements out there for it (For example, I use this instead:).
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: I love that I can be battling and still getting the ...
customer_reviews.text: I must have for any Pokemon Go player. I love that I can be battling and still getting the items from the stop at the same time. I wear mine as a clip on and have it attached to my bra strap for concealment and ease. If your button stops working to the reset on it by holding down the button until a blue light comes on and then release and press again, holding down until it vibrates. I have to do this occasionally and it fixes any issues i have. I love my Plus and would not Pokemon without it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: If you play regularly it is a must have item. It increases your time/focus flexibility so you may move to other apps, make phone calls, and especially TURN OFF YOUR DISPLAY. Of course the app and Bluetooth must still be running which still drains your battery but if you play regularly you should have a portable charger by now. 😉
customer_reviews.author: Isabella Booth

customer_reviews.title: Next time, buy new
customer_reviews.text: Bought this through Amazon's warehouse (used). For some reason, I thought it would come in its original packaging and include instructions on how it worked. It came in a small white box with a sticker on the outside 'used-acceptable'. Inside, some crumpled paper with the watch sitting on top, no instructions. If I had known about the generic packaging and no instructions I would have passed on it. Does it work, don't know. Last I heard they were looking up the instructions online.
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: Product was a fake.
customer_reviews.text: Item was a fake. Found my “lost” PoGo plus and compared to the one shipped by this company. The “Nintendo” logo on the back was blank and the item is slightly larger than the original. I also had problems with connection to the app. Would lose connection from the moment I bought it, and the battery dies out after 2-3 days. Avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mihir P.

customer_reviews.title: love the go plus
customer_reviews.text: i watched videos before buying this and they were saying how buggy it was. however they were kinda of older videos for it. Niantic has put in some updates that make it pretty cool such as spinning gyms with go plus and catching pokemon and not having to re-sync the go plus after each catch you don't want it to do. i would say like most of the people who have reviewed this the worst con is using only pokeballs and missing quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Wilson

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK WITH IPHONE X
customer_reviews.text: I would love to give this a five star review as it works really well and my husband loves it! However... I got it for him as a Christmas gift... a long with a new iPhone X. And this is not compatible with the X. We could not even get it to sync at all. So he has to use his old phone in order use this. Hopefully They will fix this, because after doing some research, the error is not on part of the iPhone but instead fault falls on this product. But my husband has no complaints using it with his iPhone 7.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Fail!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful when it works - the problem is that it never stays connected long enough in order to do as advertised. I've tried every solution known on the internet and I give up.
customer_reviews.author: Murky Night

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I first downloaded the app back when the game came out in 2016. I only made it to level 6 and quit and had deleted the app. I once again downloaded the app and began playing the game to give me a reason to walk. I am now level 30 and use this device to play. I love it. Especially when I'm at work and can't be on my phone. This makes it fun once you figure out how to use it. I strongly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rico Aldape

customer_reviews.title: Good not perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use simple! Safer then having your phone out all the time! Great for areas with tons of Pokémon stops. Not so great if they are spread out disconnects from BT when phone goes asleep.
customer_reviews.author: Wackadomommydo!

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't update frequently enough. You'll frequently miss pokemon and ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't update frequently enough. You'll frequently miss pokemon and pokestops. Sometimes i'm standing on a pokestop and it's won't vibrate. I finally get frustrated and pull out my phone and then it finally vibrates. This defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse R

customer_reviews.title: YOU NEED ONE
customer_reviews.text: The Pokemon Go Plus is amazing, it is the accessory you need if you play Pokemon Go. For adults, while you are driving to work, without having to look at your phone, enable the Plus and click it whenever it vibrates and by the time you get to work, you've caught 20 Pokemon. For kids, use this while you are on the bus going to school, put your phone in your bag, so you don't get it take away and by the time you get to school, you've caught 20 pokemon, it is the greatest.
customer_reviews.author: Ignacio Castillo - Iggy

customer_reviews.title: Depends on how you use it.
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to use it to catch Pokémon or spin poke stops without having open the app then great get it. But if you’re going for speedy catching and spinning don’t get it. It’s pretty slow and sometimes kinda buggy.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Go Plus along with the Ash Ketchum Hat for my boyfriend. He likes the Go Plus, but complains that he had to manually press the button for individual catch. After the modification, it catches and spins automatically. Now, he doesn't have to appear rude by keep looking at his phone when we hang out with friends and family. Many strangers thought the watch is cool and asked to take pictures. They thought it was a fitness watch at first. I suggest Nintendo to add a clock and a charger on this watch so it can serve more purpose. Overall, I am happy that my boyfriend is happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: piece of crap, you better off being blind and playing pokemon ...
customer_reviews.text: piece of crap, you better off being blind and playing pokemon go and and also I tried 6 different phones with this and im not talkin Walmart specials iPhone x , iPhone 8, and iPhone 7 plus and also Samsung galaxy phones all would pair for a few minutes and then be like ummmmmmm its snorlax time I forgot what I was doing
customer_reviews.author: kermit adkins

customer_reviews.title: Good for tracking distance and hitting stops with app closed but not much else
customer_reviews.text: This is nice for some uses like when I am walking with a group of people who aren't playing Pokemon and I don't want to be on my phone. That was I can still track my distance and get some catches and hit stops. Most of the time however I don't use this because I get less XP and fewer catches than I would if I played on my phone. Plus I have mostly great and ultra balls so I often can't catch anything when I'm playing because it will only throw regular pokeballs. For the price I am happy I got it but it isn't as nice as I hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great for tracking your distance for buddy walking and egg ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent product. I must have small wrists because the strap fits without a problem. Great for tracking your distance for buddy walking and egg hatching. Not the greatest success rate in catching things with it. (I run about 50/50 when I use it). Does not catch the majority of the Pokestops that I drive past, even when I slow to a crawl and the stop is curbside. Doesn't register that most of them are even there. However, when it does catch them, it makes things so much easier. All in all, I'm glad to have it and I almost never leave the house without it.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria M.

customer_reviews.title: Great while it worked. Updated*
customer_reviews.text: It was awesome really helped with the hatching of eggs. Would disconnect after like 30 min but that was ok. Catch rate is really low but it's better than not catching anything while driving. Now the reason for 2 stars... it stopped connecting after a month. It seems to be a recurring problem mentioned in other reviews. UPDATE: I don't know what it was but I reset my device (4th time) and it is now connecting to my device so that'll bring my review up to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Great fun ... while it lasts!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in August and used it daily for 6 weeks, replacing the battery twice. It worked great and I really enjoyed being able to catch 'mons and spin stops while on the go (and while in raid battles!) HOWEVER, the device bricked six weeks after I bought it, and nothing will bring it back to life. TWO emails to the support email address have gone unanswered, even though the device SHOULD still be under warranty. So as much I would have loved to give this 5 stars for all the fun and how much it helped my game, the support stinks.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy G. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: It would be an awesome thing if it worked.
customer_reviews.text: It makes a great addition to Pokemon Go, and makes egg hatching and basic Pokemon catching safer and easier. The app issues with this device are frequent and frustrating, and if Niantic can work out the bugs in the software, I could recommend it. However, due to the frequent app crashes in the background, and the numerous connectivity drops with the tracker, it doesn't make sense if you only play Pokemon Go occasionally. I have to continuously check my phone to see if the app has crashed, which almost defeats the point of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P.

customer_reviews.title: If you enjoy playing Pokemon Go, GET THIS.
customer_reviews.text: Its greatest use for getting your stardust, xp up fast. Also useful for when u can't have your phone out like at work or school. For instance when i work a shift at work i usually come home 100 pokeballs down but 50 pokemon richer. It has a catch rate of 50% and only uses the regular poke balls. It also tracks movement for eggs and buddy pokemon so that's another factor to consider. It's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Langston V

customer_reviews.title: Nice Accessory for Pokemon Go When it Remains Connected to the App
customer_reviews.text: Loses connection to the app very easily - Not sure if it's an application error or an error with the Plus itself. Works perfectly when it's connected, just wish there was a way to change the preset ball setting so if I run out of Poke Balls, it can automatically use Great or Ultra Balls instead of annoyingly buzz and flash red saying there are no Poke balls.
customer_reviews.author: simbucky

customer_reviews.title: and love using it
customer_reviews.text: I've had it since February, and love using it, but it has started to not vibrate. Is there any issues with this reported? When it does vibrate, it sounds like it's sick or something is broke on the inside. Anyway it can be replaced? Thanks
customer_reviews.author: LMS

customer_reviews.title: Occasional glitches, but otherwise incredibly useful
customer_reviews.text: The product has its glitches, but is otherwise extremely useful. Cons: It will drop out and disconnect. It will fail to reconnect in succession. More often than not, it does not respond quickly enough. Pros: Turn it on before driving to get buddy and egg distance in bumper to bumper traffic. Your EXP growth will increase dramatically. You will get more items than you ever had before. Option to disable Pokemon catches and focus just on stops. Excellent battery life. Passively works even when actively playing game (can get stops while catching something/battling in screen)
customer_reviews.author: Marc Concepcion

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it to hit up PokeStops and catch Pokemon while driving so I don't have to take my eyes off the road. It does work when your phone is locked, although most others say that the Pokemon Go app still needs to be running. I've also been keeping it in my pocket at work-not to catch Pokemon, but to record my steps, as I'm on my feet most of the time. While doing that, it does seem to disconnect after about an hour or so, probably because it's not being directly used, but it's a simple fix of opening up the app again and reconnecting it. Overall, I'm pretty glad I got it!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Simmons

customer_reviews.title: It even vibrates!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this is by far, one of the best Pokémon gadgets that you can get! It tells you when you're close to one and if you got it or missed it. The only downfall is that I work so much in one small area that I can't catch as much as I want to unless I skip my lunches and walk around tee hee hee not happening because I'm already on my feet almost all day.
customer_reviews.author: Jus_me

customer_reviews.title: Great for the pokestops
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery. For those of you who are looking to buy one it works .... but there are downsides to it. It will un-sync itself randomly when you are using it. If you set it to catch pokemon keep in mind that you are not seeing what you are catching. It will glow yellow for a pokemon you have not caught but it will only throw one ball ... if you did not catch it the pokemon runs away. Lesson is if it glows yellow and you really want that pokemon use your phone! It will use your regular balls first and once you have no more it will move to the great balls and then the ultra balls.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kolp

customer_reviews.title: I thought I'd never get one of these but now ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd never get one of these but now I can't imagine calling myself a true Pokémon trainer without one! It makes hatching eggs easier by tracking movement without having the app on the screen. It also makes it very convenient to spin Pokéstops and Gyms while sitting at a restaurant/bar for lunch/drinks, or even when riding by one while on the move.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Baynes

customer_reviews.title: Although a fun addon, it will quickly seem unwieldy.
customer_reviews.text: Although this works as you expect, it often has trouble syncing and doesn't really add as much to the game as you'd expect. Often you still need to look at your phone to enjoy the more fun parts of the game, because you either run out of inventory space, or out of balls.
customer_reviews.author: Maarten Hofman

customer_reviews.title: Go Plus
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Pokemon Go Plus. I thought my first one was broken, but it turns out you have to unpair it from your old phone before you can pair it to a new one. With this plus I will not make that mistake. Pokemon is a great way to make fitness walks more fun with a game. It goes great with using the Fitbit which is oddly like the Pokewalker from the old Pokemon game. The Go Plus gives you more credit per mile, and also gives you far more catches per day of Pokemon.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea  E Menzies

customer_reviews.title: Really just doesn't work well at all.
customer_reviews.text: Has major problems connecting and staying connected to my Galaxy S7. Every time it loses connection there's like a 10 step process I have to go through to get it back which then only sometimes works. This happens maybe 2-3 times per walk on my lunch break. When it works it's cool, it solves the whole battery drain problem with Pokemon Go but the fact that I can only use it for short stretches without stopping and troubleshooting means I've all but stopped using it. Hopefully these are the kinds of issues that can be fixed with a patch and I'll update if they ever are.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Argodale

customer_reviews.title: Won't connect
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to connect this to multiple devices (moto g5s plus, moto g5s play, OnePlus one, Samsung Galaxy tab, moto x, moto x pure, Samsung s4) And it only ever connected to the moto x, and sadly that phone no longer works. I have read numerous Reddit threads on the subject, followed Niantic's FAQ, submitted a help request to Niantic (still unanswered like 90% if my portal submissions) and tried voodoo and other black arts.
customer_reviews.author: Erich Zann

customer_reviews.title: Pokemon game play on the go.
customer_reviews.text: It works fine. I wish Niantic would change how many times it has to buzz before picking up the items and that it would give us the option of collecting pokestop items before pokemon. Not the sellers fault though. The item arrived quickly and works as programmed.
customer_reviews.author: AkKat56

customer_reviews.title: Works alright, when it works
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, if you actually manage to pair it with your device. I frequently find I can't pair it, and end up having to disable Bluetooth and restart my phone before it will pair. On top of that, it seems to just randomly unpair itself from the phone for no discernible reason. That said, when it does work it's nice. Catch rates for Pokemon are terrible, but I live in an urban area with a ton of pokestops so running out of pokeballs isn't much of a concern, and it's better than walking around with my phone out all the time, just waiting to get mugged.
customer_reviews.author: Rhea

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I may have gotten a bad Go Plus because I thought it was just a battery issue. I bought two new batteries and yet to no avail, still not working. I can't find a way to return this item or just get an exchange. Nintendo has never given me any problems before, I hope I can get an exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Pert

customer_reviews.title: Not Great
customer_reviews.text: After so many updates that the iphone and pokemon go do, this thing barely works anymore. it'll still work for around 3 minutes and then crash my app and the phone. I wouldn't recommend buying it anymore. The idea of it is great - the software just never had great execution.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Catch them all :)
customer_reviews.text: The fear I had with this item was compatibility, because I read some people have had problems connecting the device to the game. In my case, the Pokemon Go Plus works perfectly with my Xiaomi Redmi Note 4. The most likely is that you won't be using it all the time, because what's the point. But is really useful when you are exploring a new place, a new city or out just doing something and you don't want to lose all those pokemons. The only thing is that sometimes it takes a little time to detect poke stops. But that may be related to my internet connection, I don't know, even though is great to know you keep catching pokemons.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Helpful if you play a lot
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it's supposed to! I have had no issues yet. Using it with a Samsung galaxy s6. Connected easily to the app and tracks so much better than just with the phone gps alone for eggs and buddy walking. If you play a lot I'd say get it if you aren't sure! I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Vanderwende

customer_reviews.title: Good add on... not great.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bracelet. I just wish there were more bands/ accessories that could be purchased to use with. Like a holder of some sort. I will be purchasing another since I accidentally washed mine and now it's completely dead. My only complaint is how often it drops connection from your phone. Mine is constantly causing the game to restart when the phone is unlocked. If they could fix that problem this bracelet would be totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: its pretty good. Especially if you're lucky enough to be ...
customer_reviews.text: You have to disconnect and reconnect if you play for long periods of time (a day at the zoo, for example). You also have to disconnect and reconnect each time you open the app. Other than that, its pretty good. Especially if you're lucky enough to be able to walk to work/school and just grab the Pokestops along the way without having to stare at your phone the whole time.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: The PoGo Plus has been a game changer for me. It's not perfect, but I can't recommend it enough. I can't imagine playing without it now. Every once in a while it disconnects, mostly if the app closes for some reason (usually when my phone's battery is running low), but I generally don't have issues with it. It makes catching Pokemon, spinning stops, and getting kilometers much easier and saves a lot of battery on my phone. I catch so many more Pokémon I otherwise would have missed, occasionally it shows Pokémon that don't even show up on the game's screen.
customer_reviews.author: rachael

customer_reviews.title: Must have for PoGO players!
customer_reviews.text: First thing you're gonna wanna do once you get it paired and connected is turn off notifications for Pokémon. Trust me, it'll just burn through your standard pokéballs and you won't catch squat unless you're lower than level 5. But most definitely leave ON notifications for PokéStops! This allows you to catch on the phone and not miss PokéStops as you walk. Speaking of walking this thing GREATLY improves the accuracy of the distance tracking for eggs and buddy candies. It's really night and day. Device: LG G6 on unmodified Nougat 7.0
customer_reviews.author: Dime

customer_reviews.title: Not good for catching, could be better
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one directly from this page and ended up with the Japanese version with all Japanese font on the box and instructions. So I returned it and ended up getting the one in English. Even though it doesn't make a difference in game play, I wanted the English instructions. The device is not good for catching Pokemon. You only get one chance to catch them, and if it doesn't get captured then the pokemon flees. It also will not allow you to catch all pokemon that appear in the area since you may end up walking away from them without knowing it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: A solid meh
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my brother who is an avid PoGoer. There are a lot of things he dislikes such as having to replace the battery and connectivity issues with the app. It hasn't stopped him from using it though as it lets him PoGo while doing other things.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: The is great for a walk in the park or even spotlight hour. The only complain is that it only uses regular balls.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Aurelia

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit Item - Broke Quickly
customer_reviews.text: Arrived from overseas. It doesn't come in Pokemon go plus packaging but generic white box. The item will keep on disconnecting from the game roughly every hour. After two months of use, broke. I wouldn't recommend buying from this buyer at all.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Otto

customer_reviews.title: Does not work. Can you please replace it with one that does?
customer_reviews.text: this does not work. It did work for 1 week. I changed the batteries and it still does not work. I am getting a message saying that return window is closed. today is 9/25/19. Return window closed on 9/20/19. can you contact me to provide a replacement as soon as possible.
customer_reviews.author: John Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Great for Playing Pokemon Go
customer_reviews.text: Helpful when walking for the game and while trying to catch them all this take care of stops. Like on Community day where you are trying to catch over 50 Pokemon in a few hours. I do not use it for catching because I can be selective on catching and the catch rate is not 100% specially for the harder to catch which need curve throws and higher level balls.
customer_reviews.author: Storm

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Any flaws with its use is really on the game programming. There are things I really wish would improve... but you can read game blogs for that. For me, any time I'm walking around this is in my pocket and the game in the background. I end up with a full bag and a roll of the dice to catch Pokemon. It's a passive way to level and accumulate that keeps my head up and social. Most people don't even know I have it clicking away in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Ness

customer_reviews.title: It has a horrible catch rate
customer_reviews.text: Must-have for any PoGo player. It has a horrible catch rate, and it is riddled with bugs (at least on my Android phone), but I honestly can't imagine playing the game without this anymore. It greatly improves distance tracking, and it gives you an option to play in some situations where you might otherwise not be able to.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: It was good while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: I loved it while it worked. It lasted for about 6 months. It stopped connecting to my Bluetooth and wouldn't vibrate when something was around. It said it was connected but nothing happened. Pretty disappointing. I bought 2 of them and my husband's still works, so maybe I just got a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Jones

customer_reviews.title: I love that it alerts me to Pokémon that I don't ...
customer_reviews.text: I love that it alerts me to Pokémon that I don't have in my Pokedex by flashing yellow. This is great for driving as all you have to do is push the button when it vibrates. The only bummer is it only uses regular Poke balls to catch Pokémon. So if you run out of poke balls it won't start using your great balls.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Cano

customer_reviews.title: Got me back in the game!
customer_reviews.text: After a year hiatus, I felt so far behind because I wasn't able to pay attention to the app on my phone as much as I use to. So I was going days without catching Pokemon or spinning Pokestops, which made the situation worse. But when I decided to get this, it felt less like a chore, I am playing everyday, all day and gained a 4 levels! Bonus for helping me save battery life on my iphone. Win win!
customer_reviews.author: Shanda Renee

customer_reviews.title: Huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed the ease of catching Pokemon and collecting from pokestops without having to stare at my phone screen and kill my battery...for about 1 day. Since then, the PoGo+ has refused to connect to the game no matter what I try or where I am. Would be great if it actually worked, but it doesn't. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for a busy player
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Love it for just getting xp or counting my steps for eggs. It seems to lag a little with poke stops and if you have all the notifications turned on, it will always choose catching a pokemon over the stops. It throws one ball and if it doesn't catch, the pokemon runs. You have to keep the app open so it will take a hit on your battery(I recommend keeping an external charger handy)
customer_reviews.author: JMoon

customer_reviews.title: Good for farming stardust and candy. Do not use if you are actively hunting
customer_reviews.text: Love it for when I'm not actively playing the game. You WILL go through Pokeballs very quickly so make sure you can stock up on them on a daily basis. You will also have a lot of Pokemon run. If you are hunting I would not recommend using it because it does not tell what Pokemon you have found. I use it to farm stardust and candy for weaker Pokemon and if it catches a stronger Pokemon I am always pleasantly surprised. But you will not catch anything rare or of stronger type.
customer_reviews.author: cwstanky

customer_reviews.title: Meh.. potential that never came to be
customer_reviews.text: Got this during the hype period of the Pokemon Go launch. Between pairing failure or it dropping off, it never worked well consistently. After getting an old Series 0 Apple Watch I learned what Pokemon Go could be like on a wrist device.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It does what it claims, but it's not necessarily good.
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that they have since "nerfed" the product, so that it is harder to spin pokestops while on your commute. There is a disparity between stops and pokemon that vibrate. Also, it's a HUGE pain to change the battery, and they die often if you use it with any consistency. It's an okay product in that it works, but otherwise, it's a pain.
customer_reviews.author: NA

customer_reviews.title: For the price I thought it would work a little bit better.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, so far they are both working ok. Very convenient to just press a button when something is nearby and not have to look at my phone constantly. It is fairly buggy and we have to reconnect every hour or so. I wish it would have a higher catch rate but it is what it is. For the price I thought it would work a little bit better.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: It could be troublesome the first time setting it up
customer_reviews.text: It could be troublesome the first time setting it up... It took me and hubby at least one hour searching for all the tips online to make it work. Give it some time if you feel tired and think it's a defective item. Try again later and suddenly one of the old tricks you tried would work and surprise you. For us, it's worth the money we spent, for catching pokemon and spinning the stops when we drive, that's it.
customer_reviews.author: ZH

customer_reviews.title: Only uses red pokeballs and burns through them like no tomorrow
customer_reviews.text: Helps with hatching eggs due to it acting as sort of a pedometer to keep track of more accurate distance. It also allows the game to stay "awake" in the background when your phone is locked which is helpful. Only uses red pokeballs and burns through them like no tomorrow. You also only get one chance per pokemon to catch them. So it's only useful in situations where you can't catch them the normal way.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Unless you want to toss away each of your Pokeballs one by one for 25 XP apiece, don't bother. They state the catch rate at a very generous 40% - 50%, but once you get around level 30+, (you know, the point when you want to make a lot of captures because of the level-up XP jumps), it's barely even a sad 20%. I frequently go stretches with it of 10 - 15+ in a row fleeing, in areas where I know there's mainly common Pokemon everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: only good for a few months
customer_reviews.text: its defective! only good for a few months. this button keeps buzzing/vibrating without even pokemon around or it would vibrate and buz for long period of time and it wears out my battery quicker than a lightning bolts. its definitely a NOGO!
customer_reviews.author: SDHenry

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice gadget in addition to the Pokemon Go application
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice gadget in addition to the Pokemon Go application. Very useful for walking your Pokemon buddy without taking out your phone. The sync is great. It is also great hatching eggs without taking your phone out to walk the distance. One flaw is if you're riding a car/bus/train, you won't get the Pokestops in time while it's moving, it's better if you walk and let the device detect the stop. Another flaw is that you only catch Pokemon with regular pokeballs while clicking on the device, great and ultra balls will not be switched into after you run out of regular ones so it will notify that you are out of pokeballs.
customer_reviews.author: Interragator8746

customer_reviews.title: This thing takes some time getting used to. It ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing takes some time getting used to. It definitely records the steps and responds to Pokemon and pokestops. Sometimes this thing automatically turns off for no reason and I have to open the app again to turn it on. Otherwise, if you are an avid Pokemon go player, this is a necessity. Especially if your battery goes dead quickly from the app.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Great when it used to work.
customer_reviews.text: It's a cool little gadget when it works. It stopped vibrating and that defeats the whole purpose of using it while driving. Actually that defeats the whole purpose period. Why would I want to spend every waking moment looking at my wrist to see if the Plus is lighting up? I wouldn't, so it's useless now. I've heard many others complain that theirs stopped vibrating too so BUYER BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: Could It Be Kree

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it's supposed to: makes it easy to catch lots of low-CP mons to build up XP and stardust. Some people have had trouble with it losing connection to their phone, but I haven't experienced that. I like that I can manually catch a (higher value) Pokémon while it is catching a lower value one or spinning a Pokestop disk. It's helped me harvest stardust and to build my XP to level up.
customer_reviews.author: P Maines

product_meta.title: Nintendo Pokemon Go Plus
product_meta.description: The Pokemon GO Plus accessory can be used with any compatible smart phone that has the Pokemon GO application installed. After the Pokemon GO Plus is paired via Bluetooth LE and a brief setup process is completed, players can encounter and catch Pokemon like never before. When the smart phone with Pokemon GO and the paired Pokemon GO Plus accessory are within range of each other, both will begin to vibrate when a Pokemon is close by. With the convenience of not having to look at your smart phone, simply press the button on the Pokemon GO Plus to attempt to catch a Pokemon while you are out and about.
feature_bullets: The Pokémon GO Plus is a small device that lets you enjoy Pokémon GO while you're on the move and not looking at your smartphone
The device connects to a smartphone via Bluetooth low energy and notifies you about events in the game, such as the appearance of a Pokémon nearby using an LED and vibration

The Pokémon GO Plus will begin to blink and vibrate whenever you're within range of a PokéStop; Press the Pokémon GO Plus button to search the PokéStop for items; If you find any items, they'll immediately be added to your inventory
When a Pokémon is near, the light on the Pokémon GO Plus will flash; It will also flash and vibrate when you pass a PokéStop;Not compatible with Android devices that use Intel Atom processors
Once a Pokémon is close, press the button on the Pokémon GO Plus to throw a Poké Ball ;The Pokémon GO Plus will flash and vibrate to let you know if you were successful in catching the Pokémon

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars3,519 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
